entry.et: Middle English all, al, from Old English eall; akin to Old High German all all

def.dt: :the whole amount, quantity, or extent of needed all the courage they had sat up all night
:as much as possible spoke in all seriousness
:every member or individual component of all men will go all five children were present
:the whole number or sum of all the angles of a triangle are equal to two right angles
:every all manner of hardship
:any whatever beyond all doubt
:nothing but :only:
:completely taken up with, given to, or absorbed by became all attention
:having or seeming to have (some physical feature) in conspicuous excess or prominence all legs
:paying full attention with all ears
:used up :entirely consumed used especially of food and drink
:being more than one person or thing who all is coming
:as much of … as :as much of a … as all the home I ever had
:wholly quite sat all alone often used as an intensive all out of proportion all over the yard it wasn't all that funny
:selected as the best (as at a sport) within an area or organization used in combination all-league halfback
:only exclusively
:just
:so much all the better for it
:for each side :apiece the score is two all

entry.fl: pronoun, singular or plural in construction

def.dt: :the whole number, quantity, or amount :totality all that I have all of us all of the books

dt.un: used in such phrases as for all I know, for all I care, and for all the good it does to indicate a lack of knowledge, interest, or effectiveness

def.dt: :everybody everything gave equal attention to all that is all
:on the whole :generally all in all, things might have been worse
:and everything else especially of a kind suggested by a previous context cards to fill out with … numbers and all Sally Quinn
:the whole of one's possessions, resources, or energy gave his all for the cause
:ottava
:other :different :atypical allogamous allotropy
:isomeric form or variety of (a specified chemical compound) allopurinol
:being one of a group whose members together constitute a structural unit especially of a language allophone
:all the time knew the truth all along
:selected (as by a poll of journalists) as one of the best in the United States in a particular category at a particular time an all–American quarterback
:having only all-American participants an all–American basketball team
:composed wholly of American elements
:representative or typical of the United States or its ideals an all–American boy her all–American optimism
:of or relating to the American nations as a group
:one (as an athlete) that is voted all-American
:one that has all-American qualities or characteristics a clean-cut all–American
:considered in or encompassing all aspects :comprehensive the best all–around performance so far
:competent in many fields an all–around performer
:having general utility or merit an all–around tool
